entries.meaning: (uncountable) Belief in, or worship of demons or devils.
examples: […]  if he believes more of the prevalency of an ill designing Principle than of a good one, he is then more a Daemonist than he is a Theist, and may be called a Daemonist from the side to which the balance most inclines. ¶ All these sorts both of Daemonism, Polytheism, Atheism, and Theism, may be mixed  […]

entries.meaning: (uncountable, often figurative) The quality of being demonic.
examples: What a pitiful horror indeed must that Ypres desolation and desecration be—a baseness of demonism.

entries.meaning: (countable) An act or event attributed to demons or devils; an evil act.
examples: So many boys, so many places have disappeared. Blue Gate Fields, scene of many an Asiatic demonism, is gone.
